channel.title: Mom's a witch
channel.description:
Hey guys so I'm 14 and i need help.... Here are some of my restrictions
Called mom an ass = 2 weeks no computer or phone Lied about phone texts = 3 weeks no electronics No phone after 10 pm Bedtime at 10 pm Can't go to party without adult Can't do anything without adults Cant do anything with girls
Also when I got a B+ all 4 terms it wasn't good enough so I tried really hard do far this year and I tried to study and asked her to help with studying. When I couldn't memorize some Greek names easily after 2 tries she threw the paper at me and gave up. I don't know what to do because I am quite popular in school and don't know how to manage this lady.... Also I live with my grandparents and her so there's 3 adults and no kids so they are all focused on me. Please help.

item.title: Mom's a witch
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:102, topic:462820”]Jc, go to school or w.e. for another 10 years or so then reply to me when you have a bit of common sense. I don’t really feel your posts hold much value to them as all I am thinking when I read your posts is your wrong your wrong your wrong.
Oh and I wasn’t grammar nazi’ing, but hey its not my fault if your incapable of understanding simple things. Being a grammar nazi is to do with grammar, I was talking about your wording and even then I was saying your making it sound like your saying something you shouldn’t be saying.[/quote]

Kidpaparoach:

Opinions aren’t fact, can people stop saying things that indicate that they think that it is. I’m sorry but you’re insignificant, your opinion means jack.

Anyways, I’ll let you rant, you’ll understand much more about life in general in a few years or maybe decades.

Read full topic

item.title: Mom's a witch
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

@Jc Idk what to reply to that, what does that have to do with what I said to you? Your emphasising “you” too much, it sounds like your sounding like you know what I act like when you don’t.

If you really want to get into grammar, I can basically rip your post apart, so don’t start with that. Anyways, I replied.

Kidpaparoach:

Your acting like you should treat your mother with 100% respect no matter what,

No, I am not acting as if I should treat my mother with 100% respect no matter what, I am stating it.

Kidpaparoach:

your just allowing bad habbits your mum does go on and get worse and please don’t say mums don’t have any.

There are filial ways to tell your parents about their bad habits without disrespecting them.

Kidpaparoach:

I don’t think you realise their are a lot of asshole parents out their, ofc calling your mum an ass is bad but their are situations where it can be justified (not excused, but justified).

I do realize there are parents out there who aren’t parent figures to their children and are even assholes, but does that mean you can justify calling your parent an asshole?

Kidpaparoach:

I have this issue, if I don’t think someones smart and they try to argue about something with me that I feel that I know is right I look down at the person and usually belittle them.

k

Kidpaparoach:

I hate doing it, guess who I get that from? My mum(she does it all the time to me and I guess I must’ve picked it up from her), you’ve got to realise parents aren’t perfect and have confidence in the childrens decisions.

Just because you picked up a bad habit from your mother, that doesn’t mean you have the right to talk shit about her. Your parents influence you, they don’t control you. You’re the asshole that looks down and belittles others, exclusive from your mother’s upbringing of you. Her influence is permanent, but that doesn’t excuse the fact that you are incapable of thinking for yourself and in turn blame your flaws on her.

Read full topic

item.title: Mom's a witch
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:77, topic:462820”]Jc I hate to say this but what you just said was ignorant.
Your acting like you should treat your mother with 100% respect no matter what, your just allowing bad habbits your mum does go on and get worse and please don’t say mums don’t have any. I don’t think you realise their are a lot of asshole parents out their, ofc calling your mum an ass is bad but their are situations where it can be justified (not excused, but justified).
I have this issue, if I don’t think someones smart and they try to argue about something with me that I feel that I know is right I look down at the person and usually belittle them. I hate doing it, guess who I get that from? My mum(she does it all the time to me and I guess I must’ve picked it up from her), you’ve got to realise parents aren’t perfect and have confidence in the childrens decisions.
I’m not saying that the OP is correct in what he did or anything etc but I’m saying your post seems to be wrong.[/quote]

Parents aren’t perfect, but you do not have the right to disrespect your parents for that reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Mom's a witch
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Krackkid:

Why people should respect people older then them? Because its proper to do that even more so to ones parents…?

But tell me why it is proper:L(I think I already know what you mean but lets hope its something not so silly…).
I don’t know about you but I myself know what my flaws are, where my strengths lie and so forth. I am on par with older people (you seem to think older people are smarter, which of course is true to an extent).
For a month, sit down once a day for one hour or so (you shouldn’t even have to set yourself a time limit, it should just come naturally to you…) and just think about things. When I say think about things, I don’t mean pointless crap. I mean think about how things work, what makes them work, why we think they work, try to keep your brain active and open.
Knowledge doesn’t come from just reading textbooks and doing as your told.

Read full topic

Wisdom does not neccasairly come with age, people these days.

I’m actually curious to whether you genuinlly believe this and to why because I don’t understand why some people feel this way.
I’m guessing what your answers are atm and the possible ones don’t add up to a good answer to me but lets see. Convince me that I am wrong if you can.
